channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Playground fence vandalism, 27th September
item.description:
Reported by a resident “It unfortunately appears the fence of the play park by the swings has again been vandalised again: there are bits on the ground and free access for dogs into the park. I will keep trying to report to Bromley online (via FixMyStreet) but so far only get as far as completing my details, with no option available to submit. “

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wirral Wood Close, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow safety barrier on pavement, 27th September
item.description:
This barrier was first reported on 1 August and is still there. Have to walk in road to get round it or risk tripping over it. This needs removing urgently please considering how long it has been there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Hayes Chase, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees blocking pavement, 27th September
item.description:
Trees are very badly overhanging onto the pavement. Average height people cannot pass without bending or moving onto the road. Children and disabled can be hit in the face. Please trim urgently

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Choumert Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 119, Clapham Road, Oval, London

item.title: Dumped bags of rubbish in car park, 27th September
item.description:
The bags are in the car park, around the corner, between the substation and a covered campervan. The bags have been there for about a month. It appears some green waste / rubbish has been added to it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shrubland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Commercial Kitchen Units from Ranya Cafe, 27th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cadiz Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Tree is too big for a street pavement!!!, 27th September
item.description:
Who chose this tree for a street pavement? It overhangs the road and neighbouring garden - drops flowers, seeds and makes the pavement an absolute mess. Ithasalready l8fted tarmac twice and a paving slab - itneeds reolacing before it gets any bigger!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tremaine Road, Anerley, London
